posts.post_content:
I have come to this forum on occasion over the years, for help with all things baseball - from signed baseballs, to vintage cards. That said, I am new to the hobby, as it relates to Pre-WWII baseball postcards. I have gone as far as I could, down the road of homework on trying to ID these teams, and have only been able to establish the one team - 1906 Reading Pretzels, in part of course, because of "Home Run" Baker.

Can anyone provide assist on the ID of the other teams "E" and "RM" or "MR" - I would assume, since these cards were auctioned together, that both teams are part of the Tri-State league - and were located in Pennsylvania, etc, but the E does not represent the Erie Sailors, as near as I can tell, and I have no idea as to the other. Baseball-reference.com of course has extensive listings of all the teams of that era, and none seem to match up to these initials.

Any guidance would be appreciated.

Mark

Hey Mark,

If you can slide this over into the Memorabilia section you will get lots of good help.  This landed in the Buy/Sell/Trade section which isn't what you want.  Also, if you can additionally post larger individual scans it will help everybody to pull out some details of the photos.

Rob M
